content.text:
# Draft:List of tests of live nuclear warheads on missiles

List of tests of live nuclear warheads on missiles
Live nuclear warhead missile tests are extremely rare due to their high risk. Typically, missiles and nuclear warheads are tested separately. The following cases are exceptions, where a full launch was conducted with an active nuclear payload.
United States tests
{| class="wikitable"
! Name !! Date !! Warhead !! Missile !! Yield !! Location
|-
| Frigate Bird || May 6, 1962 || W47 || Polaris A-2 || 600 kt || Pacific Ocean
|-
| Plumbbob/John || July 19, 1957 || AIR-2 Genie || Airborne || ~2 kt || Nevada
|-
| Teak || August 1, 1958 || W39 || Redstone || 3.8 Mt || Johnston Atoll
|-
| Orange || August 12, 1958 || W39 || Redstone || 3.8 Mt || Johnston Atoll
|-
| Starfish Prime || July 9, 1962 || W49 || Thor || 1.45 Mt || Johnston Atoll
|-
| Swordfish (ASROC) || May 11, 1962 || W44 || RUR-5 ASROC || 10 kt || Pacific Ocean
|}
